label_mappings_by_name.Chest pain: Cardiovascular symptom. Chest pain can be cardiac (MI, angina, pericarditis), pulmonary (PE, pneumonia), gastrointestinal (GERD, esophageal spasm), or musculoskeletal. Requires careful evaluation to rule out life-threatening causes. Common ICD codes: 78650, 78659, R079, R0789. Risk stratification using HEART or TIMI scores.
label_mappings_by_name.Coronary atherosclerosis: Cardiovascular disease. Atherosclerotic heart disease of native coronary arteries, may present with stable/unstable angina or be asymptomatic. Leading cause of myocardial infarction. Common ICD codes: 41401, I25110, I2510. Management includes antiplatelet therapy, statins, beta-blockers, and possible revascularization (PCI/CABG).
label_mappings_by_name.Myocardial infarction: Cardiovascular emergency. Acute coronary syndrome with myocardial necrosis. Includes NSTEMI (non-ST elevation MI) and subendocardial infarction. Common ICD codes: I214, 41071. Requires immediate antiplatelet therapy, anticoagulation, and consideration for cardiac catheterization. Troponin elevation is diagnostic.
label_mappings_by_name.Heart failure: Cardiovascular condition. Heart's inability to pump sufficient blood. Includes acute on chronic systolic/diastolic heart failure and hypertensive heart disease with HF. Common ICD codes: 42833, I110, 42823. Symptoms: dyspnea, orthopnea, peripheral edema. Treatment: diuretics, ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, possible device therapy.
label_mappings_by_name.Atrial fibrillation: Cardiovascular arrhythmia. Irregular heart rhythm originating from atria. Includes paroxysmal and persistent afib. Common ICD codes: 42731, I480. Risk factors: hypertension, heart disease, hyperthyroidism. Complications: stroke (requires anticoagulation with CHA2DS2-VASc score), heart failure. Rate/rhythm control strategies.
label_mappings_by_name.Hypertensive heart disease with CKD: Cardiovascular-renal condition. Hypertensive heart disease complicated by chronic kidney disease. Common ICD code: I130. Represents cardiorenal syndrome where hypertension affects both heart and kidneys. Requires aggressive BP control, monitoring of renal function, and management of both organ systems.
label_mappings_by_name.Sepsis: Infectious emergency. Life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by dysregulated host response to infection. Common ICD codes: A419, 0389, 389. Requires immediate recognition, blood cultures, broad-spectrum antibiotics, and hemodynamic support. SOFA score for severity. High mortality if not treated urgently.
label_mappings_by_name.Pneumonia: Infectious respiratory condition. Infection of lung parenchyma, organism often unspecified on admission. Common ICD codes: 486, J189. Symptoms: fever, cough, dyspnea, hypoxia. Diagnosis: chest X-ray, elevated WBC. Treatment: empiric antibiotics (consider CURB-65 or PSI for severity). Can progress to sepsis/ARDS.
label_mappings_by_name.Urinary tract infection: Infectious genitourinary condition. Bacterial infection of urinary tract, site often unspecified. Common ICD codes: 5990, N390. Symptoms: dysuria, frequency, urgency, suprapubic pain. Can progress to pyelonephritis or urosepsis. Diagnosis: urinalysis, urine culture. Treatment: antibiotics based on local resistance patterns.
label_mappings_by_name.Acute kidney injury: Renal emergency. Rapid decline in kidney function (increased creatinine, decreased urine output). Common ICD codes: 5849, N179. KDIGO staging based on creatinine and urine output. Causes: prerenal (hypovolemia), intrinsic (ATN, AIN), postrenal (obstruction). May require dialysis in severe cases.
label_mappings_by_name.Depression: Psychiatric condition. Major depressive disorder characterized by persistent low mood, anhedonia, changes in sleep/appetite, concentration difficulties. Common ICD codes: F329, 311. PHQ-9 screening. Treatment: antidepressants (SSRIs, SNRIs), psychotherapy, lifestyle modifications. Monitor for suicidality.
label_mappings_by_name.Alcohol use disorder: Psychiatric/substance use condition. Pattern of alcohol use causing significant impairment or distress. Common ICD codes: 30500, F10129. CAGE screening. Complications: withdrawal (CIWA protocol), cirrhosis, pancreatitis, cardiomyopathy. Treatment: detoxification, counseling, medications (naltrexone, acamprosate, disulfiram).
label_mappings_by_name.Chemotherapy encounter: Oncology encounter. Admission for administration of antineoplastic chemotherapy for cancer treatment. Common ICD codes: Z5111, V5811. Not a diagnosis but encounter reason. Requires monitoring for chemotherapy side effects: neutropenia, nausea/vomiting, mucositis, organ toxicity. Supportive care critical.
label_mappings_by_name.Syncope: Cardiovascular/neurological symptom. Transient loss of consciousness due to cerebral hypoperfusion. Common ICD codes: 7802, R55. Causes: cardiac (arrhythmia, structural), reflex (vasovagal), orthostatic hypotension. Requires evaluation to rule out life-threatening cardiac causes. Risk stratification important.
label_mappings_by_name.Aortic valve disorders: Cardiovascular structural disease. Aortic valve stenosis or other aortic valve abnormalities. Common ICD codes: 4241, I350. Symptoms: dyspnea, angina, syncope (classic triad). Diagnosis: echocardiography showing valve area, gradient. Severe AS requires valve replacement (TAVR or surgical).
label_mappings_by_name.Acute pancreatitis: Gastrointestinal inflammatory condition. Acute inflammation of pancreas. Common ICD code: 5770. Causes: gallstones, alcohol most common. Symptoms: severe epigastric pain radiating to back, nausea/vomiting. Diagnosis: elevated lipase/amylase, imaging. Ranson or BISAP criteria for severity. Complications: necrosis, pseudocyst.
label_mappings_by_name.Psychosis: Psychiatric condition. Loss of contact with reality, unspecified etiology. Common ICD codes: 2989, F29. Symptoms: hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking/behavior. Differential: schizophrenia, bipolar with psychotic features, substance-induced, medical causes. Treatment: antipsychotics, treat underlying cause.
label_mappings_by_name.Stroke: Neurological emergency. Cerebral artery occlusion/embolism with brain infarction (ischemic stroke). Common ICD codes: 43491, 43411. Symptoms: sudden focal neurological deficits (FAST screen). NIHSS for severity. Time-critical: consider tPA if <4.5 hours, thrombectomy if large vessel occlusion. Secondary prevention crucial.
label_mappings_by_name.COPD: Respiratory chronic disease. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with acute exacerbation. Common ICD codes: 49121, J441. Progressive airflow limitation. Symptoms: dyspnea, chronic cough, sputum. Exacerbation triggers: infection, pollution. Treatment: bronchodilators, steroids, antibiotics if bacterial. GOLD staging. Oxygen if hypoxemic.
label_mappings_by_name.Pulmonary embolism: Cardiovascular/respiratory emergency. Blood clot in pulmonary arteries. Common ICD codes: 41519, I2699. Risk factors: DVT, immobility, cancer, surgery. Symptoms: dyspnea, chest pain, hypoxia, tachycardia. Diagnosis: CT pulmonary angiography, elevated D-dimer. Wells score for probability. Treatment: anticoagulation, thrombolysis if massive PE.
